intro: Monnina blakeana, commonly known as the Blake's bluemink, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of western Australia. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its delicate blue to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. It has slender, branched stems and small, ovate leaves with a slightly hairy surface. Monnina blakeana is adapted to thrive in sandy soils and is often found in coastal dunes and rocky outcrops.
